climatePledgeFriendly.details: OEKO-TEX STANDARD 100 requires textiles-based products to be tested against a list of 1,000+ chemicals, to limit those which may be harmful to human health. Certification focus: #ProductSafety and #ChemicalsUsed.

features: Care instructions White: Machine wash warm. Color: Machine wash cold. Use only non-chlorine bleach when needed. Tumble dry low. Do not iron.
body.description: Fruit of the Loom Breathable boxer briefs feature soft cotton-blend mesh fabric that promotes air flow preventing you from getting hot. Moisture wicking technology distributes sweat away from the skin, keeping you dry throughout the day. These boxer briefs have a traditional fly design with reinforced seams for better support. A wider, tag free waistband feels soft against the skin.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Long and comfortable!
reviews.reviewText: They have longer leg coverage and are very breathable for Florida weather, perfect for my husband who works in underground construction, Trust me when I tell you, they beat a lot of very expensive brand names in quality and comfort, can’t beat the price for this amazing quality! Cheaper is wayyy better then expensive on this one!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These are probably my most comfortable shorts!! The longer legs are super nice as they tend to not ride up which is definitely a plus!!! I spend the majority of my work day in a suspension harness and most shorts will wad up and make things a bit uncomfortable!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Fruit of the Loom Men's Breathable Boxer Briefs are a solid choice for everyday underwear. They offer decent comfort and breathability, thanks to the mesh fabric. The waistband sits comfortably without digging in, and the leg bands stay put. However, the sizing can be inconsistent, so it's crucial to double-check before purchase. Durability is a bit lacking; some pairs have shown signs of wear relatively quickly. They are affordable and serve their purpose for daily wear, but they lack the premium feel of higher-end brands. Overall, they're a budget-friendly option that gets the job done without any standout features.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This underwear fills a little tight but over time stretches out a little bit. Very soft cotton fabric and stays in place. No rubbing against skin even in heat.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finally...underies that fit perfectly and feel great!
reviews.reviewText: I don't like elastic bands that have to stretch too much and then put too much pressure on my waist and leave a mark when I remove the underwear later. I got the 2X Large size, which was one size larger than suggested for my actual waist size, and it just put the minimum pressure needed to keep them in place, yet leaves no mark after wearing them for hours. The material is very breathable and after a minute or so you won't even be aware you are wearing them. Very comfortable. There was another major brand I tried, but aside from being too tight in the waist, there was some chemical in their elastic waist bands that triggered an allergic reaction and left a itchy rash all around my waist! As soon as I saw that, they went right in the garbage!One slight problem I encountered, though, with these Fruit of the Loom Boxer briefs. My 3 pack contained two black and one gray "standard" length pair and I noticed that they had a bit of a chemical smell to them right out of their pack. I washed them each by hand twice in hot soapy water followed by rinses in hot fresh water. I noticed that when wringing out the two black pairs, they initially released a lot of dark dye into the water. These repeated washing have almost completely removed the chemical odor and they don't seem to be losing as much dye now. The smell and the dye loss will probably be gone with another few washings.Most importantly, these briefs fit somewhat loosely especially where they surround the thighs. The pouch gives one's "equipment" just the right amount of room. They are very cool and comfortable. There's no button down fly on them. Instead they just use the overlapped panel approach which is fine.I can recommend these "Fruit of the Loom" men's briefs. But, for maximum comfort, I recommend getting the next larger size than that listed for you actual waist size. That will assure that the waist band will not leave a mark on your skin after wearing them for hours. I also recommend hand washing them several times before wearing them for the first time just to make sure you don't absorb any loose dye molecules into your skin and body.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great FTL boxer briefs
reviews.reviewText: Fruit of the Loom has come a long way in quality, design, comfort, and style in their boxer briefs. I like these for workouts. They are very supportive throughout the day. They fit perfectly and are true to size. I will definitely purchase more in the future. These FTL boxer briefs are great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fit perfectly nice long inner thigh legs
reviews.reviewText: I'm a heavyset person and I like the box of briefs because they give the protection between your legs when you're a heavyset person so you don't get a rash and these do the job perfectly. It's hard to find long leg underwear that also doesn't heat you out like these are the good choice for that nice even heat without overheating your thighs

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: okay so i've been struggling to find boxer briefs that fit the way that don't feel uncomfortable either right away or within a half a day of wearing them... and i have spent the money on high end brands like max weldon and saxx.. but these are where it's at.they are soft, breathable, secure, and the fabric allows for full range of movement. if ya wanna do 100 squats without the risk of ripping them at the seams, these are what you should get lol.there are boxier briefs out there that give that snug feeling and do feel comfortable for a bit...but they either will bunch up, make you feel gross after a few hours of working outside or exercising, or will rip..but the fabric on these (without actually looking at what they say lol) feels like a combo of cotton and spandex.i've had them for probably 6+ months now and have washed them many many times... they still feel new every time i wear them.will definitely be getting more.
I was looking for 9 inch boxer briefs those are perfect and reasonably priced
